==Variants==
==Variants==
â
[[Image:Xubuntu704.png|thumb|right|[[Xubuntu]] 7.04 default desktop.]]
+
[[Image:Xubuntu 8.04.png|thumb|right|[[Xubuntu]] 8.04 default desktop.]]
{{further|[[List of Ubuntu-based distributions]].}}
{{further|[[List of Ubuntu-based distributions]].}}
There are several variants besides Ubuntu, both official and unofficial. Of the official variants, [[Kubuntu]]<ref name=kubushipi>{{cite web | url=https://shipit.kubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Kubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> and [[Edubuntu]]<ref name=edushipi>{{cite web | url=https://shipit.edubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Edubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> are also available free of charge via mail order through Ubuntu's ShipIt service, but Xubuntu is not available.<ref>[https://bugs.launchpad.net/shipit/+bug/62318 No shipit for xubuntu]</ref> These Ubuntu variants simply install a set of packages different from the original Ubuntu, but since they draw additional packages and updates from the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, all of the same software is available for each of them. These different versions correspond to development efforts run by largely separate groups of people who try to bring different functionalities to the distribution. The official sister distributions are:<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/other-ubuntus.html | title=Other Ubuntus | accessdate=2007-06-07}}</ref>
There are several variants besides Ubuntu, both official and unofficial. Of the official variants, [[Kubuntu]]<ref name=kubushipi>{{cite web | url=https://shipit.kubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Kubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> and [[Edubuntu]]<ref name=edushipi>{{cite web | url=https://shipit.edubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Edubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> are also available free of charge via mail order through Ubuntu's ShipIt service, but Xubuntu is not available.<ref>[https://bugs.launchpad.net/shipit/+bug/62318 No shipit for xubuntu]</ref> These Ubuntu variants simply install a set of packages different from the original Ubuntu, but since they draw additional packages and updates from the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, all of the same software is available for each of them. These different versions correspond to development efforts run by largely separate groups of people who try to bring different functionalities to the distribution. The official sister distributions are:<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/other-ubuntus.html | title=Other Ubuntus | accessdate=2007-06-07}}</ref>
